intro: Sopubia conferta var. conferta, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses in various parts of the world.
